Description:
RESTORE & RENOVATE PART OF CLUNES HISTORY
A Magnificent four bedroom Victorian home is your canvass to adventure. Capturing superb feature ceilings, central passage book ended by lead light doors, timber floors, open fire places & surrounds all offering original character and charm. Plus Blackwood and marble kitchen.
Set On a huge corner allotment only 100 metres from the main street. If you have sought an opportunity to renovate and enjoy, here's the chance. Call today to avoid disappointment.
1 Ligar Street, Clunes

Description:
SECLUDED WITH SPECTACULAR VIEWS OVER CLUNES.
This period residence sits on 2 titles surrounded by a very private and substantial garden with stone walls and terracing. The house, inspired by Edna Walling, features spectacular northern views over the historic village of Clunes. Featuring polished floorboards, two open fire places, formal dining room, sitting room, 4 bedrooms and a studio/study. Also Including a carport and workshop space.
5 Camp Parade, Clunes
Auction Saturday 3rd July 2010
12:00pm
Open from - 11:30am

Description:
Great Lifestyle Acreage Block With Shed - Power & Water Connected
This great lifestyle property is set on approx 1.352 ha (3.34 acres) & would be ideal as a weekender or to build your new home (stca). Improvements include an 8m x 6m colourbond shed with power, approx 1 acre of Shiraz vines, fruit & olive trees, dam, 2 paddocks, 5000 litre water tank & secure fencing. Town water is connected. Phone us today to inspect this fantastic property.

Description:
Affordable Clunes building block of 875 m2
This building block of 875 m2 fronts Smeaton Road (21.69metres), Clunes with a depth of 43 metres between Leslie and Canterbury Street's. Situated on the Ballarat side of the Clunes Township with services passing at front including power, town water, telephone and sealed road, town sewerage point is in the North West corner of the block. The land is cleared and sensibly priced for immediate sale with rates being $270.00 over 12 months.

Description:
THIS COULD BE YOUR HEAVEN ON EARTH
This magnificently constructed solid brick presbytery residence overlooks the township of Clunes and will tell the history of an early gold mining settlement and development of a community.
The seven roomed residence exudes charm, character and exquisite features. Superb verandah captures 180 degree views of the area. Massive central passage, high ceilings, beautiful cornices and ceiling roses, enchanting fireplaces and surrounds complemented by superb lead lighting.
As you step back in time, the grand formal lounge room, enormous bedrooms, traditionally warm welcoming kitchen was home for many tales.
At the rear of the property is the solid brick double garage, two separate rooms and laundry (copper). This property has two street frontages and is situated on 1320m2 of land.
Adjoining the presbytery on the west side and accessible from Hannah Street is a separate title of 1000m2 allotment that enjoys similar spectacular views of the township. This can be bought with the Presbytery or sold separately.
Oppotunity for prime historic real estate in a township that forged part of Victoria's and Australia's early history do not become available often - A Rare Chance Awaits.
Insights: 17 other 3 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
Griffin Estate - Creswick
This parcel is just one of the exciting releases of the Griffin Estate within Richard Court. This parcel measures 650m2 with a frontage of 20.60m perfect to fit most house plans. Those looking to chase the all-day sun should consider this block with a north facing rear yard. The court is 3 minutes back into the hub of Creswick, 11 minutes to Stockland Wendouree or 15 minutes to the CBD of Ballarat. The surrounds have you close to the Lindsay Douglas Reserve to enjoy footy, cricket, soccer, netball and lawn bowls. Needless to say, there is also great walking/bush tracks to enjoy nearby. The new estate will have you surrounded by young homes and families. Take advantage of the new government grant and secure your parcel and opportunity to live the Australian dream.

While all care has been taken to ensure the information provided herein is correct, we do not take responsibility for any inaccuracies. Description:
IMPRESSIVE CENTRAL CRESWICK HOME ON LARGE BLOCK WITH PRIVACY ASSURED
Position perfect just a short stroll from the local shopping precinct that also includes schools and medical is the immaculately presented family home with security and privacy. The home boast 4 light filled bedrooms, with the main having full ensuite and wir. The other 3 bedrooms have bir's and set away from the main bedroom. The home has the benefits of gas central heating throughout and added split system for instant heating and cooling for all year round comfort. There are also external timber shutters for privacy and internal temperature control. The kitchen boasts good cupboard space, a 900wide s/s oven plus dishwasher and is set beside the large main living area that has access to the rear of the home. Externally on the approx. 782sqm block be met with a delightful front entrance and garden area currently blooming with florals and natives set beside a cosy timber seating area, the rear of the home has private undercover bbq area ideal for those summer nights with the family and a small garden shed for outdoor requirements. One other great feature you rarely get is a long straight driveway that allows storage of a caravan or similar and rear access to drive through. Being so close to town head out the rear gates and talk the scenic walking track to do your shopping in town or just stroll around the numerous walking trails near the home, this home has so much to offer and with this location be first to inspect. Creswick is approx. 15 minutes drive to Central Ballarat and has easy access to the Melbourne freeway.
Insights: 14 other 4 bedroom house in Creswick have recently been sold.

Description:
Picturesque Home & Gardens With Stunning View of Town
This picturesque home is sure to pull on your heart strings. The high-set residence has stunning gardens and wondrous views back over town. While only being just 30 seconds back into the hub of town the abode has a feel of being private and quiet. There are three generous sized bedrooms and an office that could become an optional bedroom or nursery. The light filled living room offers spectacular views and entry out to the front balcony to enjoy maybe a glass of wine. There are external blinds for west facing windows during summer. The home is set on a large 1672m2 block that allows for gardens, work shop, garden shedding, double garage and still loads of lawn area for family fun. Charming as it is, there is still scope for people to add their new internal colour-scheme or maybe a little renovation. Glorious properties like this don't arise every day, so get in fast.
* This information has been prepared to assist solely in the marketing of this property. While all care has been taken to ensure the information provided herein is correct, we do not take responsibility for any inaccuracies. Accordingly, all interested parties should make their own inquiries to verify the information.

Description:
VALE HILL
One of regional Victorias finest homes, Vale Hill is a magnificent rural property of unsurpassed quality and sophistication. This sprawling hillside retreat set on 10 acres has captivating views of heritage-listed goldfields and volcanic plains.
A private oasis amidst landscaped formal gardens, the original miners residence circa 1858 has been meticulously restored and largely extended to showcase period charm against sleek and contemporary elegance. Expertly appointed and finished with every conceivable luxury.
Insights: First listed on 2 October, this house has been on Domain for 17 days (last updated on 2 October). It was last sold in 2016.

Description:
COUNTRY COTTAGE
Within around two hours of Melbourne CBD, within around 50km of Ballarat and 14 km of Maryborough is this little hidden treasure. Block size of around 2900 m² - yes HUGE! - in the historic Goldfields township of Talbot. Where in good times the monthly Talbot farmers market calls home. This is a cute two bedroom hardiplank cottage waiting for you. Both bedrooms with robes - not large but perhaps you might expand STCA. Lounge with reverse cycle split system. The property is in an elevated position on the block which is fully fenced, it is approximately 10 years old and has space in every direction. Double garage alongside rainwater tanks, septic system, power, 8 solar panels and misc shedding including a chook pen. Perhaps you're looking for a weekender or want a break from the city life. This is a short distance to the train station, Main Street or if you're looking to move to the country then this could be the ideal one for you!
** CURRENTLY TENANTED AND WE WOULD NEED TO GIVE NOTICE TO TENANT IN THE CASE OF YOU WANTING TO MOVE IN- ( and things are happening differently in regards to giving notice due to COVID )
Insights: 6 Regent Street, Talbot VIC 3371 was last sold in 2020.

Description:
Griffin Estate - Creswick
This parcel is just one of the exciting releases of the Griffin Estate within Richard Court. This amazing parcel at the top of the court measures 650m2 with a private driveway. Those seeking a north to north east facing block will be happy to find this option. This allotment has a wide frontage and opens further as you move towards the rear. It grants great opportunity for large shedding in the rear yard. The court is 3 minutes back into the hub of Creswick, 11 minutes to Stockland Wendouree or 15 minutes to the CBD of Ballarat. The surrounds have you close to the Lindsay Douglas Reserve to enjoy footy, cricket, soccer, netball and lawn bowls. Needless to say, there is also great walking/bush tracks to enjoy nearby. The new estate will have you surrounded by young homes and families. Take advantage of the new government grant and secure your parcel and opportunity to live the Australian dream.
* This information has been prepared to assist solely in the marketing of this property. While all care has been taken to ensure the information provided herein is correct, we do not take responsibility for any inaccuracies. Accordingly, all interested parties should make their own inquiries to verify the information.

Description:
Development Opportunity / Serious Renovators
Please contact Tony Lockyer or any of our sales consultants to arrange a convenient time to conduct a safe and controlled strictly private inspection only.
This Victorian property sits high on the service road, a short walk from the beautiful historic township of Creswick with a fantastic block size of 1274m2 with rear access provided off Pascoe Street, making it perfect for those seeking a future development opportunity (STCA). No heritage overlay applies to the dwelling, allowing buyers complete freedom when accessing their options going forward. As mentioned, a short distance to the centre of town offering shops, new supermarket, Creswick woollen mill, primary school, and a world class golf course. The much loved Creswick market is held each month and is a prime example of the spirit within the town. Convenient easy access to the Freeway, Ballarat and Daylesford. An exciting prospect to add you own touches and take this property into its next chapter.
Insights: 117 Clunes Road, Creswick VIC 3363 was last sold in 2013 and 15 other 2 bedroom house in Creswick have recently been sold.

Description:
Low maintenance living in popular Creswick.
A modest yet extremely functional family home is ready for you to secure. Perfect for the first home buyer, a young family, astute investors, or the retiree looking to downsize. Completely fenced with generous shedding and workshop combined along with carport and a separate garden shed.
This neat three-bedroom weatherboard home boasts a floor plan that is practical, offering loads of natural light, delivering a generous living, dining, and kitchen area along with well-proportioned cosy bedrooms, two with built in robes, a family bathroom and independent laundry. The kitchen provides an abundance of storage with overhead and under bench cupboards, plenty of space for food preparation along with stainless steel electric appliances adding to the functionality of the open plan zone.
This low maintenance property is just minutes from the heart of the forever popular township of Creswick and just a stone's throw to the Doug Lindsay Reserve. Set on approx. 838m2 with plenty of space for the kids to play whilst you relax on the covered in entertaining area.
Complementing the home is a wood burning fire and split system heating and cooling unit ensuring that you remain comfortable all year round. This one isn't expected to last long. Don't miss your opportunity to call us today for your private viewing.
Insights: 1 Cassels Lane, Creswick VIC 3363 was last sold in 2016 and 45 other 3 bedroom house in Creswick have recently been sold.

Description:
Incredible vineyard and country retreat awaits.
Set on approx. 20 acres in beautiful bushland near Dean, sits this wonderful, peaceful home. With 2 residences, a workshop, natural mineral water supply, a small vineyard and dam; this is truly an outstanding property for a relaxed lifestyle, entertaining or running a bed & breakfast.
Along a scenic, winding driveway, the main house is a well-constructed 2 storey sandstone brick with 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 2 living areas and study. Intelligently designed to capitalise on the stunning scenery, overlooking the picturesque dam and surrounding bush. The dam is stocked with trout, providing fresh fish for the kitchen or BBQ year-round.
Wood features prominently though the house, providing a feeling of warmth and keeping with the bush setting. The living/meals area has kauri pine floorboards and features a wood furnace. The meals area has large windows and sliding doors leading out to a patio. The kitchen is spacious with modern stainless-steel appliances, excellent cupboard and bench space, with the counter overlooking the adjoining meals and living room.
The Master bedroom is a generous size with BIR'S and connects to the large bathroom with spa bath and walk-in shower. There is a separate toilet, good-sized laundry and further study/optional bedroom to complete the ground floor.
The large upstairs bedrooms each have a balcony and share a bathroom. The vast living area has a vaulted cedar-lined ceiling, with a floor to ceiling window providing panoramic views.
A separate 2-bedroom residence previously used as a B&B offers beautiful views of the vineyard and has its own courtyard and spa filled using natural mineral water from the bore. The established vines are pinot noir and chardonnay and will produce enough grapes for 100 bottles in a good year.
** COVID 19 **
We welcome you to attend our properties for inspections, however we request that you only attend if not under any self-isolation conditions and are fit and healthy to do so. While attending an inspection, we request that all attendees show their ID and provide contact details before entering the property. We require attendees to maintain a respectable distance (1.5m apart) from the other individuals present. Finally, we request that you please refrain from touching items, fixtures and doors; if there is something that you require assistance with, our Sales Agent will be happy to help you. Thank you.
